Neptune - The 8th Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 49,528 km
 Mass: 1.02 × 10^26 kg (17 Earths)
 Orbit Period: 60,190 days (164.8 years)

Fun Facts!
 Neptune has a very active climate and many large storms occur on its upper atmosphere.
 Neptune spins on its axis very rapidly because it isn't a solid body.
 Neptune has a very thin collection of 5 rings.
 Neptune has 14 moons.

Uranus - The 7th Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 51,118 km
 Mass: 8.68 × 10^25 kg (15 Earths)
 Orbit Period: 30,687 days (84.0 years)

Fun Facts!
 Uranus hits the coldest temperatures of any planet in the Solar System.
 Uranus has two sets of very thin dark coloured rings with 13 rings in total.
 Uranus\’ 27 moons are named after characters created by William Shakespeare and Alexander Pope.
 Uranus is often referred to as an “ice giant” planet.

Saturn - The 6th Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 120,536 km
 Mass: 5.68 × 10^26 kg (95 Earths)
 Orbit Period: 10,756 days (29.5 years)

Fun Facts!
 Saturn can be seen with the naked eye.
 Saturn is the flattest planet, with its polar diameter being 90% of its equatorial diameter.
 Saturn has the most extensive rings in the Solar System with over 30 rings.
 Saturn has 150 moons and smaller moonlets.

Jupiter - The 5th Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 142,984 km
 Mass: 1.90 × 10^27 kg (318 Earths)
 Orbit Period: 4,333 days (11.9 years)

Fun Facts!
 Jupiter is the fourth brightest object in the Solar System.
 Jupiter has the shortest day of all the planets.
 The Great Red Spot is a storm on Jupiter that's over 350 years old. It's the size of 3 Earths.
 Jupiter\’s moon Ganymede is the largest moon in the Solar System.
 Jupiter has 4 rings and 67 moons.

Mars - The 4th Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 6,792 km
 Mass: 6.42 x 10^23 kg (10.7% Earth)
 687 days (1.9 years)

Fun Facts!
 Mars and Earth have approximately the same landmass.
 Mars is home to the tallest mountain in the solar system.
 Mars has the largest dust storms in the solar system.
 Pieces of Mars have fallen to Earth.
 Mars has 2 moons.

Earth - The 3rd Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 12,756 km
 Mass: 5.97 x 10^24 kg
 365.26 days

Fun Facts!
 The Earth\’s rotation is gradually slowing.
 Earth has a powerful magnetic field that protects it from the effects of solar wind.
 There is only one natural satellite of the planet Earth.
 The Earth is the densest planet in the Solar System.

Venus - The 2nd Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
 Diameter: 12,104 km
 Mass: 4.87 x 10^24 kg (81.5% Earth)
 225 days

Fun Facts!
 A day on Venus lasts longer than a year. (243 days vs. 117 days)
 Venus is the second brightest object in the night sky.
 Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system.
 Venus rotates in the opposite direction to most other planets.

Mercury - The 1st Planet from the Sun

Statistics:
Diameter: 4,879 km
 Mass: 3.30 x 10^23 kg (5.5% Earth)
Orbit Period: 88 days

Fun Facts!
 Mercury is only the second hottest planet in the Solar System despite being the closest.
 Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System.
 Mercury is the second densest planet in the Solar System.
 Your weight on Mercury would be 38% of your weight on Earth.
 Mercury does not have any moons or rings.
